articles.headline: Trapped in the Middle Seat
articles.snippet: Business travel spending has continued to rise, but that growth has mostly come from higher prices. Amid cutbacks, companies have become increasingly strategic about managing travel.
articles.abstract: Business travel spending has continued to rise, but that growth has mostly come from higher prices. Amid cutbacks, companies have become increasingly strategic about managing travel.
articles.lead_paragraph: WHILE continuing economic uncertainty around the world has rattled business confidence, it has not stopped companies — from the smallest widget-maker to the largest financial institution — from sending their battle-tested travelers back on the road this year.

articles.headline: CNN Ratings Decline Stirs Worries
articles.snippet: After recent moves failed to lift viewership, executives of the cable news pioneer are said to be under intense pressure from corporate leaders at Time Warner to turn things around.
articles.abstract: After recent moves failed to lift viewership, executives of the cable news pioneer are said to be under intense pressure from corporate leaders at Time Warner to turn things around.
articles.lead_paragraph: “Maybe CNN is just like an emergency room.”

articles.headline: Talking Business in Flight? Be Careful
articles.snippet: Doing business by phone or laptop while traveling can attract the prying eyes or ears of fellow passengers and unwittingly reveal company secrets.
articles.abstract: Doing business by phone or laptop while traveling can attract the prying eyes or ears of fellow passengers and unwittingly reveal company secrets.
articles.lead_paragraph: PETER COCHRANE, a technology consultant, entrepreneur and blogger, usually unwinds on the train between his home in Ipswich, England, and London with coffee, cookies and a newspaper.

articles.headline: The Joy of Drawing on Glass
articles.snippet: Unleash your inner artist with a new category of pen display tablets, ones that won’t clean out your bank account.
articles.abstract: Unleash your inner artist with a new category of pen display tablets, ones that won’t clean out your bank account.
articles.lead_paragraph: Much of the iPad’s magic — and its success — comes from the directness of the touch screen. For decades, you dragged a mouse on one surface to make the cursor move on another. And now, suddenly, you can tap or draw right on the screen.

articles.headline: China Curbs on Currency Still an Issue
articles.snippet: As American and Chinese officials convene talks, Treasury officials are vowing to press China to make its currency and financial systems more responsive to market forces.
articles.abstract: As American and Chinese officials convene talks, Treasury officials are vowing to press China to make its currency and financial systems more responsive to market forces.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The pace of appreciation of the Chinese currency against the dollar has slowed in the last year, ensuring that China’s manipulation of its exchange rate remains a central topic as Treasury Secretary Timothy F. Geithner arrives in Beijing for the annual dialogue between the nations.

articles.headline: For Law Students, Dewey & LeBoeuf Internships Evaporate
articles.snippet: About 30 students learned that their plum summer jobs at Dewey & LeBoeuf have vanished and are now returning, hat in hand, to ask for jobs they had once rejected.
articles.abstract: About 30 students learned that their plum summer jobs at Dewey & LeBoeuf have vanished and are now returning, hat in hand, to ask for jobs they had once rejected.

articles.headline: When Flying 720 Miles Takes 12 Hours
articles.snippet: Even with the demand for seats increasing, the big airlines have not restored many of their flights, particularly on routes to small airports.
articles.abstract: Even with the demand for seats increasing, the big airlines have not restored many of their flights, particularly on routes to small airports.
articles.lead_paragraph: It took Josh Hunter three separate planes, two connections and a two-hour drive to get from Mobile, Ala., to Cincinnati at Easter. When he added it all up, his 720-mile trip had lasted 12 hours — about the same it would have taken him to drive.

articles.headline: Romney Camp Stirred Storm Over Gay Aide
articles.snippet: Richard Grenell, a foreign policy spokesman for Mitt Romney, resigned on Tuesday after an unexpectedly messy and public dispute over his role and reputation.
articles.abstract: Richard Grenell, a foreign policy spokesman for Mitt Romney, resigned on Tuesday after an unexpectedly messy and public dispute over his role and reputation.
articles.lead_paragraph: It was the biggest moment yet for Mitt Romney’s foreign policy team: a conference call last Thursday, dialed into by dozens of news outlets from around the globe, to dissect and denounce President Obama’s record on national security.
articles.byline: By Michael Barbaro, Helene Cooper and Ashley Parker

articles.headline: A Car Chase, Secret Talks and Second Thoughts
articles.snippet: Details of intrigue, heroics and ultimately what some people involved called a betrayal emerged from Chen Guangcheng’s saga.
articles.abstract: Details of intrigue, heroics and ultimately what some people involved called a betrayal emerged from Chen Guangcheng’s saga.
articles.lead_paragraph: BEIJING — Injuries suffered in the course of a daring nighttime escape. A covert appeal from underground activists to top State Department officials for humanitarian protection. A car chase through the streets of Beijing to spirit a dissident to safety inside the fortified American Embassy.
articles.byline: By Jane Perlez and Andrew Jacobs

articles.headline: Fallout of Bin Laden Raid: Aid Groups in Pakistan Are Suspect
articles.snippet: Humanitarian work that helped millions of Pakistanis was compromised after it emerged that Dr. Shakil Afridi ran a vaccination scheme to help the C.I.A. locate Osama bin Laden.
articles.abstract: Humanitarian work that helped millions of Pakistanis was compromised after it emerged that Dr. Shakil Afridi ran a vaccination scheme to help the C.I.A. locate Osama bin Laden.
articles.lead_paragraph: PESHAWAR, Pakistan — In the shadows of the American operation that killed Osama bin Laden, the fate of a small-town Pakistani doctor recruited by the C.I.A. to help track the Qaeda leader still looms between the two countries, a sore spot neither can leave untouched.

articles.headline: A Weight Hobbling G.M.
articles.snippet: As long as General Motors’ share price stays down, the automaker is likely to be saddled with its government stakeholder.
articles.abstract: As long as General Motors’ share price stays down, the automaker is likely to be saddled with its government stakeholder.
articles.lead_paragraph: DETROIT — General Motors posted its ninth consecutive profitable quarter on Thursday. But almost three years after its taxpayer bailout and bankruptcy, the nation’s biggest automaker still can’t shed the stigma of being “Government Motors.”

articles.headline: Recovered Bin Laden Letters Show a Divided Al Qaeda
articles.snippet: Al Qaeda’s senior leadership was split by debates on tactics, strategy and even marketing in the months leading up to the raid that killed Osama bin Laden.
articles.abstract: Al Qaeda’s senior leadership was split by debates on tactics, strategy and even marketing in the months leading up to the raid that killed Osama bin Laden.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Sitting in his secret refuge, hiding from the world, Osama bin Laden spent the last months of his life rethinking strategy, worrying about his legacy and struggling to maintain control over the sprawling terrorist network that operated in his name.
